intro: Escobariopsis picta, commonly known as the pictured escobariopsis, is a species of lichen belonging to the family Caloplacaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, branched thallus that forms a crust-like growth on rock surfaces. The lichen exhibits a pale yellow to orange coloration, with intricate patterns that give it its common name. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, growing on bare rock or soil. Escobariopsis picta is a slow-growing, long-lived lichen that plays a role in soil stabilization and as an indicator of environmental conditions.
